From: "Carnage darkness" <carnage_blood@...>

** Carnage listened very carefully to Teltoli even while a few loud booms of 
thunder managed to roll by, making it so that she had to strain to hear what 
the fuzor said. It was lucky that she could read lips.
She had had to learn after working with a few corporations on silly little 
missions. Where the bangs and thunders of explosions were too loud to hear 
and they had to use arm signals and things like that to communicate. Slag! 
The more she thought about it the more the noticed that she must have lived 
through it all. Knowing everything, fighting over every terrain imaginable, 
in ever condition. Sort of made life a little boring theses days. But she 
got through it.
But even though her mind had wondered slightly she still caught every single 
word which Teltoli had said. Though she nodded at just what Teltoli said her 
mother had once spoken.** " You know, she's right. War can take a lot out of 
a person." **she sneered.** " Just look at me."
** There was no expression on her face which said whether she was ashamed of 
herself or was just speaking to hear her own voice. But Teltoli's mother was 
right dead center on war. It wasn't fun or happy or even worth leaving 
anything behind for. War was meant for the people who had no lives and had 
to have something to rebuild around to make another one. And what a lot of 
people built around was violence, hate, and sadness. And there was a word 
people used for then those three things were combined.
War.
Carnage listened to whatever training her mother had given her.** " You 
should have listened to your mother." ** and it was true. But then Carnage 
growled when Teltoli mentioned that her parents had betrothed her to a man, 
thinking that Teltoli must have grown up in a pretty posh life for that to 
happen. Though, that sort of thing also happened to royalty. Though she 
doubted that Teltoli was related to any. Though, it would be really nice to 
grow up never wondering where your next meal came from.
Carnage's eyes suddenly widened as she suddenly heard Teltoli ask her own 
question, feeling rather like she was suddenly put into the spotlight. Which 
was a really uncomfortable feeling!** " Uh....." ** Though she hadn't gotten 
through life without knowing some of the tricks of the trade. Carnage lifted 
a brow towards Teltoli. **
" Crashed. Like other of the first bots here."
** There was clue number One. She WAS one of the first bots to crash on the 
Earth. But she wanted to know if Teltoli's mind was sharp enough to pick 
that up.**
